newsitem.title: USA: Important to finish balanced budget work - Clinton.
newsitem.headline: Important to finish balanced budget work - Clinton.

text.p: President Clinton said Tuesday it was important to complete work on an agreement to balance the budget, despite a dramatic drop in the deficit.

Clinton, who just returned from a trip to Europe, told Republican and Democratic lawmakers at a White House meeting on the budget the "first order of business is to go on with the work of balancing the budget."

Clinton said the agreement between the White House and Republicans who control Congress calls for some $900 billion in spending cuts over five years. Clinton also said that the agreed entitlement reforms were needed to protect the Medicare health program for the elderly and other programs.

"The idea that we don't have to do anything I think is dead wrong," Clinton said, adding that passing another budget agreement would strengthen confidence in the U.S. economy and keep the expansion going.
Clinton said that some people were beginning to argue that since the deficit has dropped dramatically witht the growing economy, it would disappear without further Congressional action.
"I emphatically disagree with that," Clinton said.
Clinton said White House Budget Director Frank Raines told him that the budget would not balance without further action.
Senate Majority Leader Trent Lott of Mississippi said that the "atmosphere was good" surrounding the negotiations on the tax and spending plan.
"We have made real good progress in the last month," Lott said. He said lawmakers were committed to completing their work and getting legislation ready for Clinton to sign by August 1.
